title: Update app color scheme to match logo tonality

requirements.summary: Update the application's color palette in frontend/index.css to use the same tonality as the logo colors, replacing the current warm orange primary and deep navy blue secondary colors while maintaining OKLCH color space and accessibility standards
acceptanceCriteria: The primary and secondary color variables in the CSS use tonalities matching the logo
All color references throughout the app reflect the new palette
Text remains readable with appropriate contrast against backgrounds
Dark mode color variants are updated to maintain consistency

file_operations.description: Update the CSS custom properties defining the color palette to match the logo's tonality. Extract colors from frontend/public/assets/generated/logo-rotas-e-direitos.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/logo.dim_400x400.png. Replace the current warm orange primary colors (--color-primary, --color-primary-foreground) and deep navy blue secondary colors (--color-secondary, --color-secondary-foreground) with OKLCH values that match the logo's visual identity. Update all color variants including accent, muted, card, popover, and their dark mode counterparts to maintain visual consistency with the new palette. Ensure all color changes preserve WCAG AA contrast ratios for text and interactive elements. Maintain the existing OKLCH color space format and structure of the CSS variables. Do not modify the overall layout, typography, or component styling beyond color values.

requirements.summary: Update the theme color in frontend/index.html and frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest to match the updated primary color from the new palette, ensuring consistency across browser UI elements and PWA theming
acceptanceCriteria: The theme-color meta tag in index.html reflects the new primary color
The theme_color in manifest.webmanifest matches the updated palette
Browser UI chrome displays the correct brand color

file_operations.description: Update the theme-color meta tag to use the new primary color value that matches the logo tonality. Convert the OKLCH primary color value from frontend/index.css to a hex color code for the meta tag. Ensure the color value is consistent with the updated palette from REQ-1.

Update the theme_color field in the PWA manifest to match the new primary color from the updated palette. Convert the OKLCH primary color value from frontend/index.css to a hex color code. Ensure consistency with the theme-color meta tag in frontend/index.html and the overall brand identity from the logo.
